USA: The Emergency Quota Act was signed into law.
The Tulsa Race riot occurred; resulting in the deaths of up to 300 African-Americans and leaving more than 8,000 homeless.
The first meeting of the Washington Disarmament Conference of 1921 was held.
Taiwan: The Taiwanese Cultural Association is founded
Sweden: Capital punishment is abolished for all crimes committed in peacetime.
Slovenia: St. Vitus Day Constitution (Vidovdanska ustava) is adopted. It legalizes a monarchal regulation and centralism in a new state and also the supremacy of the court and the Serb politics linked with it.

An allied treaty for insurance of a situation in East Europe, attained in the Paris Peace Conference, is made by Romania and the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes. This alliance supplements the security agreement between Czechoslovakia and the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes and gets the name “Little Entente”.
Serbia: The Kingdom of Italy invades Rijeka and annexes it despite Belgrade's objections.
Poland: Signing of the Peace of Riga with Lenin concludes the Polish-Soviet War
Philippine: Charles Yeater appointed as acting Civil Governor (1921)
Leonard Wood appointed as Civil Governor (1921–1927)
Malta: Constitution of 1921 is promulgated, and it grants autonomy by providing for a bicameral legislature with the power to legislate on all matters not considered "reserved" for colonial interest.
The first Legislature is officially opened.
Latvia: Latvia became a member of the League of Nations.
Ireland: Irish War of Independence: The War of Independence ends when negotiations between the British government and representatives of the de facto Irish Republic conclude with the signing of the Anglo-Irish Treaty and the creation of the Irish Free State
Haiti: President Dartiguenave addresses United States President Warren G. Harding concerning the needs of the Haitian people
United States President Harding responds to President Dartiguenave
Germany: Hyperinflation in the Weimar Republic: Inflation of the Papiermark (Mark) began in response to the first reparations payment to the Allies under the terms of the Treaty of Versailles.
China: The Communist Party of China (CPC) was founded.
The first installment of Lu Xun's novel The True Story of Ah Q, the first work written in written vernacular Chinese, was published.
Brazil: The government implements a new policy in defense of coffee, for the third time in the history of the Republic.
Belgium: Crown Prince Hirohito's official visit to Belgium.
Bangladesh: Establishment of Dhaka University, the first university of Bengal territory (now Bangladesh).
Australia: Edith Cowan becomes the first woman elected to an Australian parliament
Albania: The Yugoslavian army invaded the Albanian territories they had not previously occupied.
A League of Nations commission forced a Yugoslavian withdrawal and reaffirmed the 1913 borders of Albania.
The Popular Party headed by Xhafer Bej Ypi formed a government, with the future King Zog of Albania acting as internal affairs minister.
